ApocalypZe, a game for two or more players, is a complicated game of skill and strategy.  Played in 5 phases, you'll find that the decisions you make about where to play your cards and how you attack, defend, and consume your resources will set the course of the game and determine victory or defeat.  Each aspect of the game is multi-layered.  In addition, you can mix and match the cards in the box to design your own decks and take control of your own ApocalypZe.

Your deck of cards represents your supplies and resources during these trying times. During the game you will consume these resources and do your best to replenish them while trying to force your opponent to waste through his own. Once you run out of supplies, you no longer have the capacity to survive and are out of the game.

During each turn you play cards to one location on the table. This may be your stronghold or your opponent's. It may also be another type of location such as a scavenging location. You must choose your location carefully each turn. If you choose to act against an opponent, you will not be able to sure up your defenses.

Throughout the course of the game you be able to defend your stronghold and scavenge for resources with survivors, and attack your opponent's stronghold and scavenging locations with zombies and other raiders. A number of types of cards that both enhance your characters and affect the game in various ways can be played throughout the course of your turn.

As the game progresses, you will be forced to consume resources (cards). As your deck dwindles, you will have to make some hard choices to insure that you will outlast your opponent and survive the ApocalypZe.

name: up N dn
description:
up N dn, first released as Auf & Ab, is essentially a climbing card game like Tichu or Gang of Four. Players take turns playing cards on the table according to certain rules until eventually one of them collects the cards.

In up N dn, however, the most important thing is not to win tricks but to get rid of your cards as quickly as possible. You can play more than one card at a time and may also get more than one opportunity to play per round, but the sudden change of play between an UP and a DOWN round can significantly affect the strength of your hand and gives the game its special flavor.

name: Crazy Bugs
description: In Crazy Bugs, a.k.a. Bizzy Bizzy Bumblebees, players each don a plastic headband that has a support rod with a magnetic bug or bee on the end of it, then they simultaneously race to pick up marbles with their magnetic deely bopper. Whoever collects the most marbles wins!

name: Chicken Wings
description:
Description from the publisher:

Necessity is the mother of invention in Chicken Wings because when the hot plate starts burning in the kitchen, those chickens want to get away from the kitchen lickety-split.

Luckily the kitchen has plenty of tools at hand, so they turn a wooden spoon into a catapult, and with one wing aiding another, they launch their poultry pals out the window. A good throw is only half the battle, though, as not all landing spots outside the kitchen are equally good, so you want to aim carefully...

name: Foil
description:
Foil is a word card game in which players draw and discard letter cards until one player can make words using all the cards in his or her hand.  All players then shuffle the letters of words they have made and then have five minutes to unscramble the words of their opponents.  Players score for words they have made, opponents' words unscrambled, and for forming words that no opponent unscrambles.

Belongs to both the 3M Bookshelf Series and the 3M Gamette Series

The game comes with 4 plastic card trays for holding draw and discard decks, a sand hourglass for tracking time, and 108 Letter Cards with alphabet letters varying in usage frequency based on the English language.

name: Het Huis Anubis
description:
Won the 2007 Dutch Toy of the Year award for Ages 8-12.

Challenge the mysteries of the House of Anubis and try to avoid the watchful eyes of Victor. The first one to collect the 6 secret tokens and get back to his/her room is the winner.

In each turn, a player draws a card and plays a card, trying to locate the tokens. Some cards are movement cards, others help in finding the tokens, yet others are keys that help open doors or theft cards that enable a player to steal a key from another player.

name: 50 Clues: Escape the Blast Zone
description:
Terrified by a message from an old friend, you try to flee Bornholm. An island far out in the Baltic Sea. Soldiers in chemical suits are patrolling the streets and the boats are sabotaged.

Escape the Blast Zone is a free 18-card mini-game, that is available at game conventions, in stores, and as a download for print’n’play. It serves as an introduction to the Sunshine Island trilogy.

50 Clues is a series of immersive puzzle games that offer the experience of an escape room, but in a format that can be played at home. You combine objects, solve puzzles and decipher codes to complete the stories. A smartphone or tablet keeps track of the solutions and provides multistep hints if the need arises.

—description from the publisher

name: The Dickens Game
description: Players move from inn to inn, collecting characters to complete the 6 chapters of a Dickens novel. The first player that has a "complete novel" wins the game. The rules state that the designer Mary Danby is a great-great-granddaughter of Charles Dickens. Past Times is a chain store of cod repro English history, with games usually produced for them by Oxford Games, but this is a game they've published themselves and the rules are in English, French and Japanese!
